tweets.text: Wetlands can play a big role in protecting us against the effects of climate change. Great to see @EnvAgency go ahead with their new floods strategy, making more use of natural flood management. Let‚Äôs make this happen, creating more wetlands as part of a #greenbluerecovery üíß üíô https://t.co/f8ENvaXQuk

@AndyGoo25313940 @EnvAgencyMids Sure (I used to work in the FD team long ago, so I know!), but that doesn't justify keeping internal business units (i.e. maintenance gangs) busy with superfluous and potentially counter-productive vegetation removal.

@EnvAgencyMids The sooner 'we' allow rivers and floodplains to function as such, rather than attempting to cleanse them for no good reason, the better. I doubt EA we be part of the forward-thinking and acting 'we' unfortunately

@EnvAgencyMids From your own commissioned research @EnvAgency ‚ÄòLWD accumulations have enormous importance for. the --structure and :diversity of. physical habitat,. water quality and temperature, and substrate conditions within British headwater rivers‚Äô
@EnvAgencyMids If you can‚Äôt bear the thought of a fallen tree in a river, the prospect of reintroducing beavers must send you into conniptions.

Boaters update : Marsh Lock has a fault and is only operating on handwind. EA Engineer scheduled to attend first thing tomorrow morning Apologises for any inconvenience caused. @thamesmobo @MarkHill03 @EnvAgencySE @wifo_ea @TW11Harbour
Please spread the word and RT and sign. And all those hard working people ‚Äúon the ground ‚Äú at the @EnvAgency who are disillusioned with your management - let‚Äôs sign! https://t.co/5Jk2oVAQVm

tweets.text: Yesterday, England‚Äôs #FCERMStrategy finished its journey through Parliament so we can now put it into action. Here‚Äôs my blog about the strategy, the importance of integrated water management, and how we‚Äôve been preparing for winter during the pandemic: https://t.co/XjrZih700g https://t.co/lTFZVCP1Ip
This is good news if someone is finally going to hold @EnvAgency to account! @MapleSave @Colne_Valley @ChilternSociety @Chilternstreams @RiverChess @RachSalv https://t.co/LvExGgXdLb

Yesterday I met with Leo Group & Omega Proteins to discuss the unacceptable odour situation around Penrith. I am following up with @EnvAgencyNW . Meantime, I encourage concerned constituents to continue to contact the EA regulator on 0800 807060 to log their complaints. https://t.co/BKkRLnIVKZ

Grants from ¬£50k to ¬£5million are available for England based nature projects to kick-start the #GreenRecovery from  #COVID19. 
 
Apply for The Green Recovery Challenge Fund at https://t.co/TYcfogFJ3g  @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency https://t.co/TfTuCzmiNt

@christiandunn @CountessPark @seekbyinat @inaturalist @BangorUni @ParsonsAlfie @FriendsCoCCP @ChesterFoE @CheshireLive @standardchester @ScienceatCZ @CheshireWT @ChesterCath @wearechester @BangorBioZoo To help you work out where the #ChesterWetlandCentre will be and where Alfie will be working, check out this photo (you'll need to open it up)

tweets.text:
Day 47 of talking about harmful and dangerous #PFAS and #PFOS chemicals in UK waters.

No one listening. No action.

Being ignored doesn't make the problem go away. 
 @EnvAgency @DefraWater @GeorgeMonbiot @carolecadwalla @BBCNews @Channel4News @jonsnowC4 @EnvAgencyYNE
#CleanWater

Want to help with citizen science in #Chester?

If you visit @CountessPark & use @seekbyinat / @inaturalist apps please record as much plant/wildlife as you can, especially in the proposed #ChesterWetlandCentre. Data will be used by @BangorUni student @ParsonsAlfie [thread...] https://t.co/eXSkh4xxzx
Sandford Lock is jammed shut - no movement and boats backing up.  Don't come down below Iffley or up from Abingdon @EnvAgencySE @IWA_UK @CRTBoating @CRTContactUs @NABO_Official

tweets.text: @SteveCJjones @EnvAgencyMids EA and its predecessor NRA have been advising against/objecting to floodplain development for decades but have been repeatedly ignored by planning authorities
You can view the latest on the #Preston & South #Ribble #Flood Risk Management Scheme here: https://t.co/fS0u63E0Xk https://t.co/HeayttpSFh

Small actions for wildlife make a big difference. 
See how local people are planning to put nature at the heart of Greater Manchester üëá 
https://t.co/mMBHaeJaEO
#GMGreenCity #MyWildGarden https://t.co/yEePCrFiFM

üëÄ Did you see this?

One study cited by the @EnvAgency found that city communities with 40% or more BAME residents have access to 11x fewer green spaces locally than predominantly white areas. 

This means less access to the health benefits too! üòñ

https://t.co/0OYhI3OG3I

Against this failure it‚Äôs time to #ActNow & #StopHS2 #OurAmazon .@HS2ltd .@grantshapps .@BorisJohnson .@Conservatives #HS2Rebellion https://t.co/Ia7ZJyEfDw

#TeamEA inspected Omega Proteins in #Penrith again yesterday. Our officers can confirm that the oxidiser has been repaired. We will continue to address other sources of odour with the operator and continue our odour surveys as well as having a regulatory presence on site https://t.co/TCf1AtnNUP

tweets.text: @NorthernGather2 @TonyJuniper @spainshall @DefraGovUK @pow_rebecca @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency Hello, beaver wetlands formed by Eurasian beavers tend to create a mosaic or series of dams, canals & ponds, unlikely to all burst at once. Instead they increase capacity & reinforce each other. If one bursts, another often takes up the slack. Time to reimagine our rivers...

We‚Äôve really come to appreciate our green spaces more this year. Help us make Greater Manchester even greener and find out small actions you can take for nature.
https://t.co/7LP6PGCyDy
#GMGreenCity https://t.co/MwvBQupGII

tweets.text:
The #FCERMStrategy is now a legally binding document

It informs our future direction to help make millions of homes and businesses more resilient to #Flooding #CoastalErosion and #ClimateChange

Read more: https://t.co/H11CyMb2v8 https://t.co/p0Yl8p64mZ

NOW ONLINE: the compelling talk from @Feargal_Sharkey 'Seven Deadly Sins' and subsequent Q&A is now online via our archive: https://t.co/5SqhqfMR6l See how our #chalkstreams got into their sorry state, who is responsible and what we can all do about it. https://t.co/3luRoH0YfV

Please don‚Äôt spoil our view üòí

Don‚Äôt be an accidental waste criminal‚ö†Ô∏è

Make sure your waste carrier is registered, check at: https://t.co/F9fWzQ0B0a

Report #WasteCrime to us on 0800 807060 or anonymously through #CrimeStoppers on 0800 555 111. https://t.co/5vbOZtxDZJ

tweets.text:
Our ports could be hiding #WasteCrime activity. 
 
Waste criminals try to profit from selling and exporting waste abroad, leaving it for someone else to deal with and potentially harming the environment. 
 
Our port officers work to stop this waste from travelling abroad üëá https://t.co/vgNsZEAPtV

urls.title: The Flood Strategy is go!
urls.description: The Environment Agency‚Äôs Flood and Coastal Erosion Risk Management Strategy finished its journey through Parliament, meaning that we can start to put it into action, getting the nation better protected and prepared for the effects of climate change for decades to come.

tweets.text: https://t.co/Lq1ztMH1yB It‚Äôs go! The strategy outlines how businesses need to play their part in flood resilience. Look out for our workshops on PFR and NFM to see how we can support your business to get involved @EmmaHowardBoyd @UniOfHull @EnvAgency #floodinnovation #PFR #NFM

Some easy things you can look into during Flood Resilience Awareness Week to be more prepared for flooding are to: 
üîµ check your flood risk
üîµ sign up to @EnvAgencyNW flood warnings
üîµ create a flood plan
üîµ create a flood kit 

Give @TheFloodHub a follow for some more tips! https://t.co/up4AhheQHW
Before and after pics. Our field team has been working in the Alcester area #Warwickshire to prevent blockages by clearing a fallen tree from the River Arrow #flood #teamEA https://t.co/hq5myIBzyW

@gow_derek What a prospect for @EnvAgency to consider - sturgeon once again spawning on clean gravel-beds, below the crystal-clear Humber tributaries of the Ure, Swale, Ouse, Wharf, Trent, etc.; joining sea lamprey as an increasingly abundant species . . . . What a thought @gow_derek üôèüëç

urls.title: Home - Wildlife Ways
urls.description: Wildlife Ways is a ¬£16.8 million programme, part-funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF), to improve Solihull borough for the benefit of people and wildlife. It will include tree, bulb and wildflower planting and make it easier for people wanting to walk and cycle by widening and connecting paths and cycle routes with green spaces.

annotations.normalized_text: 650m of Kingshurst Brook in Chelmsley Wood

tweets.text: Project to re-naturalise 650m of Kingshurst Brook in Chelmsley Wood on track. Narrowed channel = increased water velocity = cleansed gravel bed (4th photo) Funded by EA and ERDF https://t.co/sdweOZi0gu @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @Team4Nature @WKWT @LoveSolihull @SolihullUpdates https://t.co/ha4cVG5rc7
So very proud to be part of this project! https://t.co/8vTQLLq8Wp

* No English river met @EnvAgency quality tests for pollution
* Only 14% are of "good ecological standard"
* 200,000 sewage discharges per yr
"A culture is no better than its rivers." (WH Auden, adapted)
Water companies & EA cuts are leading to disaster.
https://t.co/BuihH2ZNHN

A compelling and devastating round-up of the calamity facing England's rivers and the "Hotbed of mediocrity", that is the @EnvAgency.

Great stuff by @RachSalv https://t.co/d01T1Ts2Ft

NEWS: @DefraGovUK ¬£40million Green Recovery Challenge Fund open now for application. Grants from ¬£50k to ¬£5million are available for England based #nature projects to kick-start #GreenRecovery from the #COVID19 pandemic. @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency
